New Records: The New York Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series, their first in 15 years.
Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run homer for the Yankees.
The Yankees won Game 5 of the ALCS 5-2 in 10 innings.
The Guardians rallied to win Game 3 on two, two-run homers in their last two at-bats.
The Yankees held on to win Game 4 after blowing a four-run lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Juan Soto celebrated his home run by dancing down the first-base line and pausing to celebrate with his teammates.
Cleveland's surprising season under first-year manager Stephen Vogt ended just short of a World Series.
The Cleveland Guardians remain without a title since 1948, baseball's current longest drought.
